dsense.name: mainly

example.eg: The fire department is mainly responsible for fire prevention.

dsense.name: at the weekends (UK), on the weekends (mainly US)
dsense.guideword: (on Saturday or Sunday in given period)

example.eg: When I lived in France, I worked in Rouen during the week and stayed with friends in Paris at the weekends.

dsense.name: canvas, plural: canvases (mainly US), canvasses (mainly UK)

example.eg: The art students were supplied with several blank canvasses each.
example.egtrans: 艺术系的学生们每人分到了几张空白的画布。

dsense.name: canvas, plural: canvases (mainly US), canvasses (mainly UK)

example.eg: The newly discovered canvas by Monet is expected to fetch $80 million.
example.egtrans: 新发现的莫奈油画预计将卖出8000万美元。

dsense.name: dietician, also mainly US: dietitian

example.eg: Meagan became a dietician because she wanted to help people lead healthier lives.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 营养学家, 营养顾问

dsense.name: frying pan, skillet (mainly US), also US: frypan, fry pan

example.eg: She served the potatoes right out of the skillet.
example.egtrans: 她把刚从煎锅出炉的土豆端了上来。

dsense.name: half brother (mainly US), half-brother (mainly UK)

example.eg: My half-brother and I have different fathers.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 同母异父的哥哥, 同母异父的弟弟, 同父异母的哥哥, 同父异母的弟弟

dsense.name: half sister (mainly US), half-sister (mainly UK)

example.eg: My half-sister's 15 years younger than me.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 同父异母的妹妹, 同父异母的姐姐, 同母异父的妹妹, 同母异父的姐姐

dsense.name: have a green thumb, have green thumbs (mainly US), have green fingers (mainly UK)

example.eg: My mother has a green thumb: everything she touches grows well.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 善于园艺, 善于种花种草

dsense.name: ketchup, also mainly US: catsup

example.eg: Do you want ketchup on your burger?

dsense.name: landslide, also mainly UK: landslip

example.eg: Heavy rains have caused landslides throughout the area.
example.egtrans: 暴雨在整个地区都造成了塌方。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 山崩，土崩，塌陷, 塌方，坍塌

dsense.name: on the weekend (mainly US), on weekends (mainly US), at the weekend (UK), at weekends (UK)

example.eg: The City of London is quiet at the weekend.

dsense.name: on the weekend (mainly US), at the weekend (UK)

example.eg: I saw Steve on the weekend and he told me to say hi to you.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 上周末, 上一个周末

dsense.name: on the weekend (mainly US), at the weekend (UK)

example.eg: Bye for now! See you on the weekend!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 下周末, 下一个周末

dsense.name: reexport [sth] (mainly US), re-export [sth] (mainly UK)⇒
reexport (mainly US), re-export (mainly UK)
reexport (mainly US), re-export (mainly UK)
soybean (mainly US), soy bean (mainly US), soya bean (mainly UK)

example.eg: They serve edible soybeans as an appetizer.

dsense.name: soybean (mainly US), soy bean (mainly US), soya bean (mainly UK)

example.eg: Have you tried this new soybean dip?

dsense.name: spiderweb (US), spider web (mainly US), spider's web (mainly UK)

example.eg: The hikers encountered many spiderwebs on the little-used trail.

dsense.name: stepmom (mainly US), step-mom (mainly US), stepmum (UK), step-mum (UK)
